page.title: 10Farming around Bourton
page.content: Two farms studied near{Bourton-on-the- {water}were{Moore Farm}(130 metres) just west of the Dikler and{Court {Hayes Farm}(230 metres) on the west- facing slope above{Wyck Rissington. {Court Hayes Farm}is mainly a{chicken {farm}with{40 000 birds.}A herd of{50 {cows}provide{400 litres}of milk{daily. {Four men}are employed on the{167 acre {farm}with 100 acres arable.{Modern {machinery}is used to keep up with safety regulations.{Silage}is produced for the{daily feed.}The 1\ acres of {woodland}is just sufficent for a pheasant shoot.{Moore Farm}has 200 acres, of which 60 are arable. There are{6 horses,}a{dairy herd}and a{few {sheep.}There are about 2 acres of {woodland.}Both farms rotate crops from year to year but{feed}and{fertiliser (Nitram) is obtained in bulk from{West {Midland Farmers}in Bourton.
